meanings.sent1: After losing his way in the forest, he had to regain his bearings to find his way home.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to regain her strength after being sick for a week.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful cat had to regain its composure after getting startled by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The team needed to regain their focus if they wanted to win the game.
meanings.sent5: With determination, she knew she could regain her confidence and face her fears.

meanings.definition: To reach or come to again; return to
meanings.sent1: The hiker had to regain the summit before sunset.
meanings.sent2: After the power outage, it took a while for the lights to regain their brightness.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy student tried to regain consciousness after nodding off in class.
meanings.sent4: The old clock had to regain its ticking rhythm after being still for years.
meanings.sent5: The sun will eventually regain its place in the sky after the storm passes.

meanings.sent1: The athlete trained hard to regain her title as the champion.
meanings.sent2: He had to regain ownership of his stolen bike from the thief.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to regain his missing rabbit for the grand finale.
meanings.sent4: The company worked tirelessly to regain their reputation after the scandal.
meanings.sent5: She needed to regain her favorite book from her forgetful friend.
